info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued June 25 at 7:34PM CDT by NWS QuadCities
info.description: ...A strong thunderstorm will impact portions of eastern Mercer and southwestern Henry Counties through 800 PM CDT... At 734 PM CDT, Doppler radar was tracking a strong thunderstorm near Woodhull, or 12 miles southwest of Cambridge, moving east at 30 mph. HAZARD...Wind gusts of 50 to 55 mph and penny size hail. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Minor damage to outdoor objects is possible. Locations impacted include... Galva, Woodhull, Alpha, Bishop Hill and Nekoma. This includes Interstate 74 in Illinois between mile markers 29 and 33. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.75 IN MAX WIND GUST...55 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building. A Severe Thunderstorm Watch remains in effect until midnight CDT for northwestern Illinois.
